actions.text: On agreeing to the Connolly amendment (A004) Failed by recorded vote: 176 - 239 (Roll no. 172).
Amendment failed in Committee of the Whole
House amendment offered/reported by: Amendment (A004) offered by Mr. Connolly.
House amendment not agreed to: On agreeing to the Connolly amendment (A004) Failed by recorded vote: 176 - 239 (Roll no. 172).
Roll call votes on amendments in House

description: An amendment numbered 4 printed in House Report 113-88 to require a threat assessment of pipeline vulnerabilities to terrorist attack and corrective actions necessary to protect the pipeline from such an attack and to mitigate any resulting spill.
purpose: Amendment sought to require that the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, in consultation with the Department of Homeland Security, conduct a study of the vulnerabilities of the Keystone XL pipeline to a terrorist attack and certify that necessary protections have been put in place.
